title: tikv panic: called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value
body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?
<!-- You can run `tikv-server --version` -->

### What operating system and CPU are you using?
<!-- If you're using Linux, you can run `cat /proc/cpuinfo` -->

### Steps to reproduce
1. Deploy TiDB cluster with CDC node
2. Create Kafka changefeed 
3. Run workload 
```
/go-tpc tpcc --db workload --warehouses 30 -T
 30 --host upstream-tidb.cdc-testbed-tps-7596532-1-844 --port 4000 --parts 8 prepare --ignore-error '2013,1213,1105,1205,8022,8028,9004,9007,1062'
/go-tpc tpcc --db workload --warehouses 30 -T 30 --ho
st upstream-tidb.cdc-testbed-tps-7596532-1-844 --port 4000 --parts 8 --time 30m0s run --ignore-error '2013,1213,1105,1205,8022,8028,9004,9007,1062'
```

### What did you expect?
TiKV should not panic

### What did happened?
